rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment reports deaths factually without using high-potency verbs or potent metaphors.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The segment reports deaths but lacks explicit calming language.
No bare negation or statement of absence/unlikelihood.
Reports counts of deaths using standard verbs: "16 laying hens had also died and by March 2, three geese, three peacocks and one duck had died too".
